sections.text: TO 02/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW. NEW REGION 7822 (S14 W78) PRODUCED THE LARGEST FLARE OF THE PAST DAY, A B9/SF AT 02/2004Z. THIS SMALL REGION EMERGED TO THE SOUTHEAST OF SPOTLESS PLAGE 7821 (S10W88). A LONG-DURATION B5 OCCURRED AT 02/0305Z. sections.text: TO 03/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7822 (S13W89) PRODUCED A C2/SF AT 03/0401Z. ACTIVITY FROM THIS REGION IS DECREASING AS IT APPROACHES THE WEST LIMB. NEW REGION 7823 (S10E73) ROTATED AROUND THE EAST LIMB. SO FAR IT IS TWO SMALL SPOTS AND HAS NOT BEEN ACTIVE. THESE SPOTS MAY BE ASSOCIATED WITH OLD REGION 7815 (S11 L-228).

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 02/2100Z TO 03/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE AT MOST STATIONS. STORM CONDITIONS OCCURRED AT SOME HIGH LATITUDE LOCATIONS FROM 03/0600-1200Z. THIS ACTIVITY MAY BE ASSOCIATED WITH A SOUTHERN CORONAL HOLE. THE GREATER THAN 2 MEV ELECTRON FLUX WAS MODERATE AFTER ABOUT 03/1600Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE BECOMING QUIET TO UNSETTLED BY THE END OF THE THREE-DAY FORECAST PERIOD. STORM CONDITIONS MAY BE EXPERIENCED AT SOME HIGH LATITUDE LOCATIONS DURING LOCAL NIGHTTIME.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT TWO DAYS. LEVELS ARE EXPECTED TO INCREASE TO UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE ON DAY THREE IN RESPONSE TO THE DISAPPEARING FILAMENT FROM 5 JAN.

sections.text: TO 16/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW. REGION 7827 (S07E25) CONTINUES TO BE THE ONLY SPOTTED REGION ON THE DISK. THE GROUP SHOWED SLOW GROWTH AND PRODUCED OCCASIONAL B-LEVEL FLARES. X-RAY LOOP STRUCTURES WERE OBSERVED ON EAST LIMB SUGGESTING THAT A NEW REGION MAY SOON ROTATE INTO VIEW. sections.text: VERY LOW. THERE IS A FAIR CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED C-CLASS FLARE SOMETIME OVER THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

AN EXCEPTIONAL PERIOD OF ACTIVITY OCCURRED FROM ABOUT 1100-1300UT (THUS AFFECTING THE K-INDEX LEVEL FROM 0900-1500): CONDITIONS WERE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS DURING THIS TIME INTERVAL.

sections.text: TO 17/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW. REGION 7827 (S07E11) HAS CONTINUED TO GROW, PARTICULARLY IN THE TRAILER SPOTS. THE REGION DID NOT PRODUCE ANY SIGNIFICANT FLARE ACTIVITY. NEW REGION 7828 (S13W10) EMERGED ON THE DISK TODAY AND IS CURRENTLY A SMALL C-TYPE SPOT GROUP. ANOTHER NEW REGION (7829 AT S14E80) ROTATED INTO VIEW TODAY. THIS GROUP CORRESPONDS TO THE LIMB ACTIVITY REPORTED YESTERDAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 16/2100Z TO 17/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS AT MID-LATITUDES AND FROM QUIET TO SEVERE STORM AT HIGH LAT- ITUDES. AN INITIALLY QUIET FIELD BECAME DISTURBED SHORTLY AFTER 0600Z. PERIODS OF SUBSTORM ACTIVITY PERSISTED UNTIL AROUND 1500Z, WITH THE HIGHER LATITUDE STATIONS SHOWING PARTICULARLY STRONG ACTIVITY. THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS PREDOMINANTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE DAY, ALTHOUGH SOME ISOLATED ACTIVE PERIODS WERE OBSERVED IN SOME LOCATIONS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE GENERALLY UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT TWO DAYS. LOCAL NIGHTTIME SUBSTORMING IS EXPECTED TO PERSIST. AN INCREASE TO ACTIVE CONDITIONS IS EXPECTED ON THE THIRD DAY (20 JANUARY) AS A RESPONSE TO A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE.

sections.text: TO 18/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7827 (S07W00) PRO- DUCED TODAY'S ONLY C-CLASS EVENT: A C1/SF AT 1742Z. THIS GROUP CONTINUES TO GROW AND HAS DEVELOPED A MAGNETIC DELTA CONFIG- URATION IN THE LEADER AS SPOTS OF OPPOSITE POLARITY HAVE MERGED. REGION 7829 (S13E67) HAS ROTATED MORE FULLY INTO VIEW AND IS A BIPOLAR REGION OF MODEST AREA (140 MILLIONTHS). 7829 AND REGION 7828 (S13W23) WERE BOTH QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.text: LOW. REGION 7827 IS THE MOST LIKELY SOURCE FOR FLARE ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 17/2100Z TO 18/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM QUIET TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. CONDITIONS WERE PREDOMINANTLY AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FROM THE BEGINNING OF THE PERIOD THROUGH 0800Z, WITH SOME BRIEF MAJOR STORM PERIODS AT ISOLATED HIGH LATITUDE SITES. SINCE 0800Z CONDITIONS HAVE BEEN MOSTLY IN THE QUIET TO UNSETTLED CATEGORIES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. NIGHTTIME SUBSTORMS ARE LIKELY TO PERSIST FOR AT LEAST ANOTHER DAY. EFFECTS FROM A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE ARE ALSO LIKELY TO KEEP ACTIVITY LEVELS ENHANCED THROUGH THE THIRD DAY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 24/2100Z
sections.text: TO 25/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW.  TWO OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED C1 X-RAYS EVENTS OCCURRED THIS PERIOD.  THE FIRST WAS RECORDED AT 25/0006UT AND THE SECOND OCCURRED AT 25/0129UT. REGION 7827 AT S07 LO114 ROTATED AROUND THE LIMB THIS PERIOD. BASED ON ITS WHITE LIGHT GROWTH BEFORE ROTATING OFF, THIS REGION MIGHT BEAR WATCHING IN TWO WEEKS WHEN IT'S DUE TO RETURN. THE LARGEST REGION ON THE DISK, 7830 (N12W20), HAS BEEN VERY QUIET.  THOUGH IT HAS DECAYED IN SPOT NUMBER AND OVERALL SIZE, ITS BASIC CONFIGURATION HAS REMAINED UNCHANGED.  REGION 7829 (S14W20) REMAINS THE MOST ACTIVE REGION ON THE SUN.  7829 HAS DECAYED MOSTLY INTO RUDIMENTARY PENUMBRA BUT INCLUDES NEW SPOTS THAT COULD DISTINGUISH THIS REGION AS TWO SEPARATE GROUPS. FURTHER DEVELOPMENT IS NOT EXPECTED.  THE REMAINDER OF THE DISK AND LIMB WAS QUIET AND UNCHANGED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS AS BOTH REGIONS 7829 AND 7830 HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO PRODUCE C-CLASS X-RAY ACTIVITY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 25/2100Z
sections.text: TO 26/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW.  THREE C-CLASS X-RAY EVENTS WERE OBSERVED THIS PERIOD, TWO CORRELATED WITH REGION 7829 (S14W33).  THE LARGEST OF THESE WAS A C2/1N EVENT WHICH MAXED AT 26/0750UT.  THIS REGION HAS GENERALLY MAINTAINED ITS WHITE LIGHT CONFIGURATION.  AN EXTREMELY ACTIVE FILAMENT EXTENDS THROUGH REGION CENTER AND DEFINES THE INVERSION LINE.  REGION 7830 (N11W34) REMAINS AS THE LARGEST REGION ON THE DISK.  IN WHITE LIGHT, THE REGION HAS SHOWN OVERALL DECAY, PARTICULARILY IN THE TRAILER PORTION OF THE GROUP.  NO SIGNIFICANT ACTIVITY HAS BEEN OBSERVED FROM 7830 IN THE PAST 24 HOURS.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS AS BOTH REGIONS 7829 AND 7830 HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO PRODUCE C-CLASS X-RAY ACTIVITY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 29/2100Z
sections.text: TO 30/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7832 (S20W57) PRODUCED TWO C-CLASS FLARES AND A B-CLASS FLARE WITH AN ASSOCIATED TYPE IV SWEEP. THE LARGEST OF THE C-CLASS FLARES WAS A C4.2/SF AT 30/1907Z. REGION 7834 (S13E72) WAS RESPONSIBLE FOR A C2/SF FLARE AT 30/0117Z. THERE WERE TWO UNCORRELATED C-CLASS FLARES AS WELL. REGIONS 7834 AND 7833 (S18E36) ALSO EACH PRODUCED SUB FAINT FLARING. REGION 7832 WAS A MERE PLAGE REGION YESTERDAY BUT QUICKLY REFORMED INTO A CSO SPOT GROUP. THIS REGION HAS PROVEN TO BE FAIRLY PROLIFIC OVER THE PAST 24 HOURS. REGION 7834 WAS NUMBERED TODAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. REGIONS 7832 AND 7834 HAVE A GOOD CHANCE FOR CONTINUED C-CLASS FLARING AND AN OUTSIDE CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE. REGION 7832 HAS A SLIM CHANCE FOR OCCASIONAL C-CLASS FLARING.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 29/2100Z TO 30/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO MINOR STORM FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. HIGH LATITUDE STATIONS HAVE BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS. ACTIVITY IS BECAUSE OF A WELL POSTIONED RECURRENT CORONAL HOLE. GREATER THAN 2 MEV ELCTRON FLUX RANGED FROM MODERATE TO HIGH DURING THE LAST HALF OF THE PAST 24 HOUR PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO MINOR STORM AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND UNSETTLED TO MAJOR STORM AT HIGH LATITUDES FOR THE NEXT 12-18 HOURS. ACTIVITY IS THEN EXPECTED TO DECLINE TO QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 30/2100Z
sections.text: TO 31/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7832 (S21W72) WAS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE ONLY TWO OPTICALLY CORRELATED C-CLASS FLARES OF THE PERIOD, A C1/SF FLARE AT 30/2117Z AND A C2/SF FLARE AT 31/1554Z. SIX UNCORRELATED C-CLASS X-RAY BURSTS WERE RECORDED, THE LARGEST OF WHICH WAS A C9 BURST AT 311005Z. X-RAY IMAGING TAKEN AT THE TIME OF THE FLARE ASSOCIATES THIS BURST WITH REGION 7832. THIS REGION CONTINUED TO GROW DURING THE PERIOD. REGION 7834 (S12E60) CONTINUED TO GROW AS WELL. IT PRODUCED FOUR B-CLASS FLARES DURING THE PERIOD, ONE OF WHICH WAS A B6/1F FLARE AT 31/1204Z. REGION 7833 (S16E31) CONTINUED ITS SLOW DECAY.

sections.text: LOW. REGION 7832 HAS A GOOD CHANCE OF CONTINUED C-CLASS ACTIVITY AND AN OUTSIDE CHANCE OF AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE. REGION 7834 HAS A FAIR CHANCE OF PRODUCING C-CLASS ACTIVITY AND ALSO HAS AN OUTSIDE CHANCE OF PRODUCING AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 31/2100Z
sections.text: TO 01/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY BECAME MODERATE. REGION 7832 (S21W82) PRODUCED M1 FLARES AT 01/0906Z AND 01/0932Z. MINOR RADIO BURSTS ACCOMPANIED THESE EVENTS. A TYPE II WAS OBSERVED BETWEEN 01/0844-0847Z (BEFORE THE BEGIN TIME OF THE FIRST M- CLASS FLARE). THERE WAS A POSSIBLE DELTA IN REGION 7832 ON 31 JAN. REGION 7834 (S13E49) PRODUCED A C7/1N FLARE AT 01/0826Z. THIS REGION IS GROWING AND MIXED POLARITIES WERE OBSERVED HERE DURING THE PERIOD. AN EIGHT DEGREE LONG FILAMENT LOCATED NEAR S23E33 FADED BETWEEN 01/1620-1650Z. A SPOTLESS PLAGE NEAR S09E70 PRODUCED SEVERAL SUBFLARES AND WAS NUMBERED AS NEW REGION 7835.

sections.text: GENERALLY LOW. ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARES ARE POSSIBLE FROM REGIONS 7832 AND 7834. REGION 7832 WILL ROTATE FROM VIEW ON 02 FEB AND BECOME LESS OF A THREAT AFTER THAT TIME.

sections.text: SHOULD BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. THERE IS A POSSIBILITY OF BRIEF ACTIVE CONDITIONS ON 04 FEB IN RESPONSE TO THE FLARE ACTIVITY AND TYPE II ON 01 FEB.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 02/2100Z
sections.text: TO 03/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY RETURNED TO MODERATE LEVELS. REGION 7834 (S13E19) PRODUCED AN IMPULSIVE M4/2B FLARE AT 03/0151Z WITH MODERATE RADIO BURSTS AND TWO DISTINCT TYPE II SWEEP EVENTS. THIS REGION DECAYED SOMEWHAT BUT MIXED POLARITIES REMAINED AND GREW SLIGHTLY. A SMALL FILAMENT NEAR REGION 7833 (S17W10) ERUPTED AND WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A LONG DURATION B2 X-RAY ENHANCEMENT WHICH SPANNED THE PERIOD 03/0920-1107Z. THE SAN VITO OBSERVATORY REPORTED A MORETON WAVE EMANATING FROM THE ERUPTION SITE AND TRAVELLING TOWARD REGION 7834. YOHKOH IMAGERY FOLLOWING THIS EVENT SHOWED A VERY LARGE AREA OF ENHANCED EMISSION OVER MOST OF THE SOUTHEAST QUADRANT INDICATING A PROBABLE CORONAL MASS EJECTION AND SIGNIFICANT REARRANGEMENT OF THE OVERLYING CORONAL FIELDS.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD BE
sections.text: MOSTLY LOW. REGION 7834 RETAINS THE CAPABILITY OF PRODUCING OCCASIONAL M-CLASS EVENTS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 02/2100Z TO 03/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE. SOLAR WIND DATA INDICATE THE EARTH IS STILL UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF A LOW DENSITY STREAM, PROBABLY OF CORONAL HOLE ORIGIN. THE ONLY CANDIDATE HOLE IS THE SOUTHERN POLAR HOLE. ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUXES AT GEOSYNCHRONOUS ALTITUDE WERE IN THE MODERATE TO HIGH RANGE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE UNTIL EARLY ON 06 FEB WHEN A MAJOR STORM IS EXPECTED TO BEGIN IN RESPONSE TO THE PROBABLE CORONAL MASS EJECTION MENTIONED ABOVE. PERIODS OF SEVERE STORMING ARE POSSIBLE DURING THAT TIME. PREDICTION OF THE ARRIVAL TIME OF THIS DISTURBANCE IS DIFFICULT. THE ACTUAL BEGIN TIME COULD BE OFF BY AS MUCH AS A DAY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 03/2100Z
sections.text: TO 04/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 7834 (S13E05) PRODUCED AN M2/2B AT 04/1544Z WITH A TYPE II AND MODERATE CM BURSTS. THE X-RAY RISE WAS IMPULSIVE AND SO WAS THE EARLY DECAY. HOWEVER, THE LATE DECAY PHASE LASTED OVER 4 HOURS. THIS REGION SHOWED SLIGHT OVERALL DECAY BUT AN OPPOSITE POLARITY ISOLATED POLE SOUTH OF THE LEADER SPOT REMAINED. MAGNETIC GRADIENTS WERE MODERATE THERE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD DECLINE
sections.text: TO GENERALLY LOW LEVELS AS THE SUNSPOT AREA IN REGION 7834 CONTINUES TO DECREASE. AN OCCASIONAL SMALL M-CLASS FLARE FROM THIS REGION REMAINS A POSSIBILITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 03/2100Z TO 04/2100Z:
sections.text: AT THE BEGINNING OF THE PERIOD, THE FIELD WAS UNSETTLED. MINOR STORM CONDITIONS WERE OBSERVED IN THE 03/0000-0300Z PERIOD. ACTIVE LEVELS WERE DETECTED BETWEEN 0300-0900Z. THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED. THE GREATER THAN 2 MEV ELECTRON FLUXES WERE AT MODERATE TO HIGH LEVELS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD REMAIN UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR 05 FEB. A MAJOR STORM IS FORECAST TO BEGIN ON 06 FEB IN RESPONSE TO A PROBABLE CORONAL MASS EJECTION ON 03 FEB. PERIODS OF SEVERE STORMING ARE POSSIBLE. MINOR TO MAJOR STORM CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED ON 07 FEB. ISOLATED SEVERE STORM LEVELS ARE POSSIBLE ON THAT DAY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 04/2100Z
sections.text: TO 05/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7834 (S12W08) PRO- DUCED ALL OF TODAY'S LIMITED FLARE ACTIVITY. THE LARGEST EVENT WAS A C5/1N AT 1352Z. THE GROUP SHOWS AN INCREASE IN SPOT COUNT BUT A SLIGHT WEAKENING OF THE MAXIMUM FIELD STRENGTHS. NEW REGION 7837 (N02W04) EMERGED ON THE DISK TODAY. A 13 DEGREE FILAMENT NEAR N29W12 DISAPPEARED SOMETIME BETWEEN 04/2255Z AND 05/1130Z.

sections.text: PREDOMINANTLY LOW. THERE CONTINUES TO BE A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENT FROM REGION 7834.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 05/2100Z
sections.text: TO 06/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7834 PRODUCED OC- CASIONAL SMALL FLARES DURING THE PERIOD: THE LARGEST WAS A C3/1F AT 0655Z. THIS GROUP HAS SHOWN A SLIGHT DECLINE OF THE TOTAL NUMBER OF SPOTS IN THE LAST 24 HOURS AND LOSS OF PEN- UMBRA ON ALL BUT THE DOMINANT LEADER SPOT.YOHKOH SXT OBSERVA- TIONS INDICATE THAT A NEW ACTIVE REGION IS APPROACHING EAST LIMB FROM BEHIND THE SOLAR DISK.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. THERE CONTINUES TO BE A SLIGHT THREAT FOR AN ISOLATED M- CLASS FLARE FROM REGION 7834.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 05/2100Z TO 06/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT PREDOMINANTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS. AN ISOLATED SUBSTORM WAS OBSERVED AT HIGH LATITUDES FROM 1200-1500UT. THE ANTICIPATED GEOMAGNETIC DISTURBANCE DID NOT MATERIALIZE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT TWO DAYS. A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE IS LIKELY TO INCREASE ACTIVITY LEVELS TOMORROW LASTING THROUGH THE SECOND DAY. CONDITIONS SHOULD BE GENERALLY UNSETTLED BY THE THIRD DAY. THE GREATER THAN 2 MEV ELECTRON FLUX OBSERVED BY GOES HAVE BEEN AT HIGH LEVELS SINCE LATE ON 31 JANUARY THROUGH EARLY TODAY (6 FEBRUARY), BUT HAVE SHOWN A DOWNWARD TREND TOWARDS MODERATE LEVELS OVER THE LAST 12 HOURS.

sections.text: TO 07/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW. REGION 7834 PRODUCED ONLY A FEW B-CLASS SUBFLARES TODAY. THE REGION DID EXHIBIT SOME FILAMENT ACTIVITY AND DEVELOPED SOME PENUMBRA IN THE LEADER PORTION OF THE REGION. THE OVERALL MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION HAS SIMPLIFIED TO A PRIMARILY BI-POLAR GROUP, ALTHOUGH THERE IS SOME WEAK MIXING OF FIELDS IN THE TRAILER SPOTS. sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 19/2100Z
sections.text: TO 20/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 7844 (N11E16), NEWLY NUMBERED YESTERDAY, DEVELOPED RAPIDLY AND PRODUCED AN M1/1N FLARE AT 20/0321Z WITH AN ASSOCIATED TYPE II SWEEP. THE REGION THEN BEGAN TO DECAY SLOWLY AND HAS BEEN RELATIVELY INACTIVE SINCE. REGION 7843 (S13E03) HAS BEEN A PROLIFIC FLARE PRODUCER THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD. IT PRODUCED 5 C-CLASS FLARES, THE LARGEST OF WHICH WAS A C3.9/1N FLARE AT 20/0111Z, AND A NUMBER OF SUBFAINT FLARES. THIS REGION CONTINUED TO DEVELOP AND IS NOW MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX WITH A BETA-DELTA MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION NEAR THE REGION CENTER. THE OTHER SPOTTED REGIONS ON THE DISK WERE STABLE. NO NEW REGIONS WERE NUMBERED TODAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. REGION 7843 HAS A GOOD CHANCE FOR CONTINUED C-CLASS FLARE ACTIVITY AND A CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE. REGION 7844 IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE ITS DECAY AND TO REMAIN GENERALLY INACTIVE IN FLARE PRODUCTION. THERE IS STILL A SMALL CHANCE FOR OCCASIONAL C-CLASS ACTIVITY IN THIS REGION AND AN OUTSIDE CHANCE FOR ANOTHER SMALL M-CLASS FLARE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 27/2100Z
sections.text: TO 28/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW. REGION 7846 (S16E33) PRDUCED A B8/SF FLARE AT 0620Z. THIS GROUP HAS CONTINUED TO GROW AND IS NOW A 0240 MILLIONTHS D-TYPE REGION. IT ALSO IS SHOWING SOME MIXED MAGNETIC POLARITIES IN THE SMALL, TRAILER PORTION OF THE REGION. A SMALL FILAMENT NEAR S09E36 DISAP- PEARED BETWEEN 0011Z AND 1439Z. THE REMAINDER OF THE GROUPS ON THE DISK WERE STABLE AND QUIET.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. THERE IS A REASONABLY GOOD CHANCE FOR ISOLATED C-CLASS FLARES FROM REGION 7846 OVER THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 27/2100Z TO 28/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY ACTIVE AT MID-LATITUDES AND WAS AT ACTIVE TO STORM LEVELS AT HIGH LATITUDES FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE PEAK OF THE DISTURBANCE WAS BETWEEN 0600-1200Z WHEN MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS WERE REPORTED AT MANY SITES. THE MOSTLY LIKELY SOURCE FOR THE DISTURBANCE WAS THE FILA- MENT ERUPTION OF 26 FEBRUARY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE PREDOMINANTLY UNSETTLED WITH OCCASIONAL ACTIVE PERIODS OVER THE NEXT THREE DAYS. SOME RESIDUAL EFFECTS ARE ANTICIPATED OVER THE NEXT 12 HOURS AS THE CURRENT DISTURBANCE SUBSIDES.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET UNTIL ABOUT 04/0900Z. SINCE THEN IT GRADUALLY BECAME UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM AT HIGH LATITUDES. THE SOURCE OF THIS DISTURBANCE IS NOT CLEARLY KNOWN. THE GREATER THAN 2 MEV ELECTRON FLUX WAS HIGH.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE. A RECURRENT DISTURBANCE ASSOCIATED WITH A CORONAL HOLE IS EXPECTED TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE ACTIVITY BEGINNING ON MARCH 6.

sections.text: TO 05/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW.  THE LARGEST EVENT ON THE DISK WAS A B4/SF FROM REGION 7848 (S14W52) AT 05/0621UT. NEW REGION 7850 (S22E17) WAS NUMBERED THIS PERIOD AS A 2 SPOT BXO BETA GROUP.  ALL OTHER REGIONS WERE QUIET AND INDICATED SLIGHT DECAY.

THE GREATER THAN 2 MEV ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUX WAS PREDOMINATELY NORMAL TO MODERATE UNTIL 05/2030UT WHEN THE FLUX ROSE TO HIGH LEVELS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO REMAIN AT MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. PERIODS OF MAJOR STORM CONDITIONS ARE ALSO EXPECTED, PARTICULARILY AT HIGH LATITUDE STATIONS DURING LOCAL NIGHTTIME.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT TWO DAYS.  BY DAY THREE, THE FIELD IS EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE IN RESPONSE TO A RECURRENT CORONAL HOLE FEATURE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 06/2100Z
sections.text: TO 07/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW.  THE LARGEST EVENT OF THE PERIOD WAS AN OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED B7 X-RAY EVENT WITH WEAK LOWER DISCRETE FREQUENCY RADIO EMISSION.  REGION 7846 (S16W58) REMAINS THE LARGEST REGION ON THE DISK AT 160 MILS. OVERALL, THE REGION HAS EXHIBITED SOME DECAY IN THE TRAILER PORTION OF THE GROUP.  REGION 7849 (S07W65) HAS SHOWN THE MOST CHANGE INDICATING A TWO TO THREE-FOLD INCREASE IN AREA AND SPOT COUNT BUT STILL REMAINING A BXO BETA GROUP.  NO OTHER SIGNIFICANT CHANGES NOTED ON THE REMAINDER OF THE DISK OR LIMB.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW FOR THE FIRST TWO DAYS OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.  REGION 7846 STILL HAS THE POTENTIAL TO PRODUCE C-CLASS X-RAY ACTIVITY BEFORE IT ROTATES AROUND THE DISK.  ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO DECREASE TO VERY LOW BY DAY THREE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 06/2100Z TO 07/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS THE PAST 24 HOURS.  THE GREATER THAN 2 MEV ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUX WAS AT MODERATE LEVELS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY QUIET TO ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. PERIODS OF MINOR TO MAJOR STORM ACTIVITY CAN BE EXPECTED AT ALL LATITUDES DURING LOCAL NIGHTTIME HOURS.  A RECURRENT CORONAL HOLE FEATURE IS ROTATING INTO FAVORABLE POSITION AND IS EXPECTED TO BE THE PRIMARY REASON FOR THE ACTIVITY INCREASE.

sections.text: TO 11/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW. THERE WAS NO SIGNIFICANT ACTIVITY ON THE SUN OVER THE PAST 24 HOURS. NEW REGION 7851 (S15E63) WAS NUMBERED TODAY. THIS IS THE SOLE SPOTTED REGION ON THE SOLAR DISK.

sections.text: VERY LOW. THERE IS ONLY A VERY SLIGHT CHANCE FOR C-CLASS ACTIVITY ON THE DISK.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. HIGH LATITUDE STATIONS RANGED FROM QUIET TO MAJOR STORMING. ACTIVITY IS MOST LIKELY BECAUSE OF A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE. THE GREATER THAN 2 MEV ELECTRON FLUX RANGED FROM NORMAL TO HIGH LEVELS OVER THE PAST 24 HOURS.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT 12 HOURS. ACTIVITY IS THEN EXPECTED TO DIMINISH TO QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 12/2100Z
sections.text: TO 13/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY REMAINED VERY LOW. AN OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED LONG DURATION B6 OCCURRED BETWEEN 13/0639-0724Z. A STRONG TYPE II WAS OBSERVED WITH THIS EVENT. A SMALL REGION EMERGED NEAR N08W43 AND WAS NUMBERED AS NEW REGION 7853. THE GOES X-RAY BACKGROUND INCREASED FROM ABOUT A4 TO B1 DURING THE PERIOD. NO YOHKOH DATA WERE AVAILABLE TO DETERMINE IF A NEW REGION IS AT THE EAST LIMB.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD CONTINUE
sections.text: AT A VERY LOW LEVEL.  HOWEVER, THE EAST LIMB SHOULD BE WATCHED FOR THE APPEARANCE OF A NEW REGION OR RETURNING REGION 7844 NEAR N11.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 12/2100Z TO 13/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED BETWEEN UNSETTLED TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. SOME MAJOR TO SEVERE STORM CONDITIONS WERE OBSERVED AT HIGH LATITUDE SITES. SOLAR WIND DATA INDICATE THERE IS A HIGH SPEED, LOW DENSITY STREAM IN THE EARTH'S VICINITY INDICATING THE SOURCE TO BE A CORONAL HOLE IN THE FAR SOUTHWEST QUADRANT OF THE SUN. THE GT 2 MEV ELECTRON FLUXES WERE HIGH.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE ON 14 MAR. ISOLATED MINOR STORMING IS POSSIBLE EARLY ON 14 MAR. UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE FORECAST FOR 15 MAR AS THE CURRENT CORONAL HOLE RELATED DISTURBANCE SUBSIDES. QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS ARE EXPECTED ON 16 MAR.

sections.text: MOSTLY LOW WITH C-CLASS FLARES POSSIBLE FROM NEW REGION 7854. AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE MUST BE CONSIDERED POSSIBLE. ONCE MORE IS KNOWN ABOUT THIS REGION, A MORE CONFIDENT ASSESSMENT CAN BE MADE.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE AT ALMOST ALL LATITUDES. REAL TIME SOLAR WIND DATA INDICATE A DECREASE IN VELOCITY OF ABOUT 100 KM/S OVER VALUES OBSERVED ON 13 MAR. ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUXES WERE IN THE HIGH TO VERY HIGH CATEGORIES DURING THE PERIOD.

sections.text: SHOULD BE UNSETTLED TO SLIGHTLY ACTIVE ON 15 MAR AS THE CURRENT DISTURBANCE SUBSIDES. QUIET TO UNSETTLED CONDITIONS ARE FORECAST FOR 16-17 MAR.

sections.text: TO 18/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW. A LONG DURATION B5 X-RAY EVENT WAS OBSERVED FROM 1904Z THROUGH THE END OF THE PERIOD. THE EVENT WAS TIME COINCIDENT WITH A WEAK TYPE II SWEEP (1922-1937Z) AND WITH A SUB-FAINT H-ALPHA FLARE FROM REGION 7854 (S16E26). THE H-ALPHA SIGNATURE WAS DESCRIBED AS CONSISTING OF PARALLEL RIBBONS IN THE FAR WESTERN PART OF THE REGION. NO OTHER SIGNIFICANT ACTIVITY WAS OBSERVED TO OCCUR DURING THE PERIOD. TWO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED TODAY AS 7856 (N12E38) AND 7857 (N14E64).

sections.text: TO 20/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7854 (S16W02) WAS MORE ACTIVE TODAY WITH FREQUENT SUBFLARE ACTIVITY. THE GROUP MANAGED TO PRODUCE A C1/SF AT 1737Z. THIS EVENT WAS PROMPTLY FOLLOWED BY THE ERUPTION OF A 12 DEGREE FILAMENT AND A LONG DURATION B5 X-RAY EVENT FROM 1857Z TO 2043Z. THE SPOTS OF 7854 SHOWED TRANSITION TODAY FROM A SIMPLE BETA MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION TO BETA-GAMMA WITH THE APPEARENCE OF SOME SMALL NEGATIVE POLARITY SPOTS IN FRONT OF THE LARGE LEADER SPOT COMPLEX. sections.text: TO 22/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. AN M2 X-RAY FLARE OCCURRED AT 22/1641Z. AN OPTICAL REPORT WAS NOT RECEIVED FOR THIS FLARE AND IT WAS NOT ASSOCIATED WITH SIGNIFICANT RADIO OUTPUT. THE FLARE COULD HAVE ORIGINATED FROM ONE OF THE DISK REGIONS OR POSSIBLY FROM AROUND THE SOUTHEAST LIMB NEAR THE SITE OF OLD REGION 7846(S16,L=259, DAI/390 ON 01 MAR). SURGING AND X-RAY IMAGE ENHANCEMENT IS VISIBLE NEAR THIS LOCATION. SPOTS HAVE NOT YET BEEN REPORTED. REGION 7854 (S16W27) IS THE LARGEST DISK REGION AND HAS PRODUCED A NUMBER OF SMALL FLARES. REGION 7857 (N16E13) HAS GROWN BUT HAS NOT PRODUCED ANY FLARES.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 26/2100Z
sections.text: TO 27/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW.  REGION 7858 (S16E21) REMAINED THE MOST ACTIVE REGION ON THE DISK PRODUCING A B9/SF AT 27/1857UT.  ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FLARE WAS REPORTED WEAK RADIO EMISSION COVERING 25 MHZ TO 15.4 GHZ.  IN THE PAST 24 HOURS, THIS REGION HAS GROWN QUITE DRAMATICALLY NEARLY DOUBLING ITS AREA AS VIEWED IN WHITE LIGHT.  IT ALSO HAS INDICATED MORE MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY EVOLVING FROM A SIMPLE BETA TO A BETA GAMMA DELTA GROUP.  NO OTHER SIGNIFICANT ACTIVITY REPORTED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW.  REGION 7858'S MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY LENDS ITSELF TO C-CLASS ACTIVITY WITH A WEAK CHANCE OF M-CLASS ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 26/2100Z TO 27/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS IN THE MIDDLE LATITUDES FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.  AT HIGHER LATITUDES, THE FIELD WAS MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE WITH PERIODS OF MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS OBSERVED.  THE GREATER THAN 2 MEV ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUX WAS AT NORMAL BACKGROUND LEVELS BUT DID INDICATE A RAPID RISE TOWARD MODERATE LEVELS THE LAST 6 HOURS OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE AT ALL LEVELS FOR THE FIRST TWO DAYS OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.  HIGH LATITUDES CAN EXPECT ISOLATED PERIODS OF MINOR STORM CONDITIONS DURING THAT TIME FRAME.  THE FIELD IS EXPECTED TO RELAX TO MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED BY DAY THREE.  A WELL POSITIONED SOUTHERN CORNOAL HOLE IS THOUGHT TO BE RESPONSIBLE FOR THE ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 06/2100Z TO 07/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM QUIET TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. AN INITIALLY QUIET FIELD BECAME GRADUALLY DISTURBED BEGINNING AROUND 0200Z. THE DISTURBANCE BECAME A MINOR STORM AT MID-LATITUDES AND A MAJOR STORM AT HIGH LATITUDES. THERE WERE SOME BRIEF PERIODS OF MAJOR STORM AT MID-LATITUDES AND SEVERE STORM AT HIGH LATITUDES DURING THE MOST INTENSE PART OF THE DISTURBANCE. THESE DISTURBED PERIODS WERE FROM 0600-0800Z, 0900-1000Z, AND 1500-1700Z. THE DISTURBANCE WAS MOST LIKELY CAUSED BY A CORONAL HOLE: NEAR REAL-TIME WIND OBSERVATIONS (FROM 1618-1959Z) INDICATED A SOLAR WIND SIGNATURE OF RELATIVELY HIGH VELOCITY, LOW DENSITY, AND GENERALLY SOUTHWARD INTERPLANETARY FIELD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO STORM LEVELS FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS. THE LOCAL NIGHTTIMES ARE EXPECTED TO EXPERIENCE SIGNIFICANT SUBSTORM ACTIVITY. ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO PERSIST THROUGH THE SECOND AND THIRD DAYS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 07/2100Z TO 08/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM QUIET TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS. MIDDLE LATITUDE SITES WERE PREDOMINANTLY ACTIVE BUT HAD DROPPED TO QUIET FOR THE LAST THREE HOURS OF THE PERIOD. HIGH LATITUDES WERE AT MOSTLY MINOR STORM LEVELS BUT HAD SOME MAJOR STORM PERIODS. WIND OBSERVATIONS FROM 1652-1904Z TODAY SHOWED A LOW DENSITY, HIGH SPEED SOLAR WIND WITH A PERSISTENTLY NORTH- WARD MAGNETIC FIELD COMPONENT. THE GREATER THAN 2 MEV GOES ELECTRON FLUXES ATTAINED HIGH LEVELS TODAY AFTER 1230UT AND INCREASED TO VERY HIGH LEVELS AFTER 1650UT. THE TYPICAL FLUX WAS HOVERING NEAR 6 X 10^4 AT FORECAST ISSUE TIME.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 21/2100Z
sections.text: TO 22/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY BECAME HIGH. DEPARTING REGION 7863 (S04W94) PRODUCED A M7/2F FLARE AT 22/1151Z. MINOR CENTIMETRIC BURSTS WERE OBSERVED WITH THIS EVENT AS WAS A MODERATE INTENSITY TYPE IV. SIGNIFICANT MATERIAL MOTIONS ALONG THE WEST LIMB WERE REPORTED BY OPTICAL OBSERVERS. ADDITIONALLY, AN M1 WAS OBSERVED AT 22/1742Z WITH REGION 7863 AS THE PROBABLE BUT UNVERIFIED SOURCE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD BE LOW TO
sections.text: MODERATE. ALMOST NOTHING IS KNOWN ABOUT THE EVOLUTION OF REGION 7863 SO PERSISTENCE IS THE ONLY FORECAST TOOL AVAILABLE. THIS INFERS THAT AN ISOLATED HIGH M-CLASS OR LOW X-CLASS FLARE IS POSSIBLE. TOWARD THE END OF THE PERIOD, REGION 7863 SHOULD BE FAR ENOUGH BEHIND THE WEST LIMB THAT ALL BUT MASSIVE FLARES WOULD BE OCCULTED.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 21/2100Z TO 22/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET FOR THE FIRST HALF OF THE PERIOD. THE LATTER HALF WAS MOSTLY UNSETTLED WITH ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM CONDITIONS DETECTED AT SOME HIGH LATITUDE SITES. A WEAK GT 10 MEV PROTON ENHANCEMENT BEGAN NEAR 22/1340Z. FLUXES AFTER 1500Z WERE NEAR THE 1-2 PFU LEVEL. ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUXES BEGAN THE PERIOD AT MODERATE TO HIGH LEVELS AND BECAME LOW TO MODERATE DURING THE REMAINDER OF DAY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD BE PREDOMINANTLY ACTIVE FOR 23-24 APR. OCCASIONAL MINOR TO ISOLATED MAJOR STORMING IS POSSIBLE DURING THAT TIME. UNSETTLED TO SLIGHTLY ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE FORECAST FOR 25 APR. IN THE ABSENCE OF ANOTHER LARGE FLARE FROM REGION 7863, THE CURRENT PROTON ENHANCEMENT IS EXPECTED TO SLOWLY DECAY OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 22/2100Z
sections.text: TO 23/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. A C9 FLARE OCCURRED AT 23/0216Z AND A LONG DURATION C1 REACHED MAXIMUM AT 23/1706Z. DEPARTED REGION 7863 (S04W106) IS THE LIKELY SOURCE OF THE FIRST EVENT AS THERE WERE NO SPOTS ON THE VISIBLE DISK DURING THE PERIOD AND YOHKOH IMAGERY SHOW NO SIGNIFICANT REGION BEYOND THE EAST LIMB. THE LONG DURATION C1 WAS IN TIME COINCIDENCE WITH A VERY ACTIVE PROMINENCE AT NW17. REPORTS OF MATERIAL FALLING BACK TO THE SURFACE WERE RECEIVED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD BE
sections.text: LOW FOR AT LEAST ONE MORE DAY WITH FLARES OCCURRING BEYOND THE WEST LIMB. THERE IS AN ISOLATED POSSIBILITY OF ANOTHER M-CLASS FLARE FROM THAT LOCATION BEFORE IT ROTATES COMPLETELY FROM VIEW. VERY LOW LEVELS ARE FORECAST FOR 25-26 APR.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 22/2100Z TO 23/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS PREDOMINANTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE. SOME HIGH LATITUDE SITES EXPERIENCED ISOLATED MINOR TO MAJOR STORM PERIODS. THE MINOR PROTON ENHANCEMENT THAT BEGAN ON 22 APR SLOWLY DECLINED TO NEAR BACKGROUND LEVELS DURING THE PERIOD. ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUXES WERE LOW EARLY IN THE PERIOD BUT INCREASED TO MODERATE LEVELS AT THE END.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: IS FORECAST TO BE PREDOMINANTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR 24-25 APR. MINOR TO MAJOR STORM PERIODS AT HIGH LATITUDES ARE PROBABLE DURING THAT TIME. QUIET TO UNSETTLED CONDITIONS ARE FORECAST FOR 26 APR. ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUXES SHOULD INCREASE TO HIGH LEVELS OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 26/2100Z TO 27/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM QUIET TO STORM LEVELS. CONDITIONS WERE INITIALLY UNSETTLED TO SLIGHTLY ACTIVE. A PERIOD OF ACTIVE TO STORM LEVEL CONDITIONS BEGAN AROUND 0600Z AND LASTED THROUGH 1400Z. THE MOST INTENSE PERIOD WAS FROM 0600-0900Z; MID-LATITUDES EXPERIENCED MINOR TO MAJOR STORM AND HIGH LATITUDES ATTAINED MAJOR TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS. THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS PREDOMINANTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED FROM 1400Z UNTIL THE END OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS IN RESPONSE TO A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE. ACTIVITY SHOULD SUBSIDE TO MOSTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE SECOND AND THIRD DAYS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 27/2100Z TO 28/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS PREDOMINANTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. BRIEF ACTIVE PERIODS OCCURRED BETWEEN 0400-0500Z AND 0800-1000Z. sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 15/2100Z TO 16/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM QUIET TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS. AN INITIALLY QUIET FIELD BECAME UNSETTLED TO SLIGHTLY ACTIVE FROM ABOUT 0300Z TO 0800Z WITH SOME ISOLATED HIGH LATITUDE MINOR STORM LEVELS BETWEEN 0500-0700Z. CONDITIONS QUIETED BRIEFLY BUT BECAME MOSTLY ACTIVE FROM 1000Z THROUGH 1800Z. DURING THE MOST DISTURBED PART OF THE LATTER PERIOD (1200- 1500Z), MID-LATITUDES ATTAINED MINOR STORM LEVELS AND HIGH LATITUDES WERE AT MAJOR TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 16/2100Z
sections.text: TO 17/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7870 (N10W51) GREW SLIGHTLY TODAY AND PRODUCED A FEW SUBFLARES. THE GROWTH RATE AND FLARE FREQUENCY WERE CONSIDERABLY REDUCED COMPARED TO YESTERDAY. THE REGION SHOWS A RELATIVELY SIMPLE BETA MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION WITH STRONG TRAILER SPOTS. REGION 7871 (S13W20) GREW SIGNIFI- CANTLY TODAY AND IS NOW THE LARGEST GROUP ON THE DISK AT 300 MILLIONTHS. NEVERTHELESS, FLARE ACTIVITY FROM THIS REGION WAS REDUCED OVER THE LAST 24 HOURS. THE GROUP HAS STRONG MAGNETIC FIELDS IN A TYPICAL BIPOLAR MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. THERE CONTINUES TO BE A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED M- CLASS EVENT FROM EITHER OF 7870 OR 7871.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 16/2100Z TO 17/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM UNSETTLED TO STORM LEVELS. CONDITIONS WERE PREDOMINANTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FROM 16/2100Z TO 17/0400Z. ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS DOMINATED BETWEEN 0400-1100Z, WITH SOME MAJOR TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS AT THE HIGH LATITUDE SITES. CONDITIONS HAVE BEEN MOSTLY UN- SETTLED SINCE 1100Z. A BRIEF LOOK AT SOLAR WIND CONDITIONS TODAY SHOWED A MODERATELY FAST, LOW DENSITY WIND WITH SOUTH- WARD BZ, SUGGESTING THAT THE ACTIVITY OF THE LAST 24 HOURS WAS PROBABLY FROM A CORONAL HOLE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS DUE TO CONTINUED CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS. CONDITIONS SHOULD SUBSIDE TO MOSTLY UNSETTLED FOR THE SECOND AND THIRD DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 02/2100Z
sections.text: TO 03/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY REMAINED VERY LOW. EARLY IN THE PERIOD, A SMALL REGION EMERGED NEAR NOOW11 AND WAS NUMBERED AS NEW REGION 7874. SMALL SPOTS BECAME VISIBLE IN AN EXISTING PLAGE NEAR S17E50 AND THIS AREA WAS NUMBERED AS REGION 7875. SEVERAL SMALL FILAMENTS FADED FROM VARIOUS LOCATIONS ON THE DISK.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD REMAIN AT
sections.text: A VERY LOW LEVEL FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. A NEW REGION MAY APPEAR AT THE NORTHEAST LIMB WHICH MAY INCREASE LEVELS SLIGHTLY, BUT MORE DATA ARE NEEDED FOR A MEANINGFUL FORECAST.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 02/2100Z TO 03/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE. BRIEF MINOR STORM CONDITIONS WERE OBSERVED AT SOME HIGH LATITUDE SITES. RECENT SOLAR WIND DATA INDICATE THAT THE CORONAL HOLE STREAM FROM THE FAR SOUTHWEST QUADRANT OF THE SUN IS STILL IMPACTING THE EARTH. HOWEVER, THE VELOCITY WAS DECREASING WHICH MAY IMPLY WE ARE NEAR THE END OF THAT HIGH SPEED STREAM. ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUXES WERE PREDOMINANTLY HIGH.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. ISOLATED ACTIVE PERIODS ARE POSSIBLE, ESPECIALLY ON 04 JUN, AS THE CORONAL HOLE RELATED DISTURBANCE SUBSIDES.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 03/2100Z
sections.text: TO 04/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW. REGION 7874 (N01W27) GREW RAPIDLY DURING THE PERIOD AND PRODUCED FREQUENT INTENSITY FLUCTUATIONS AND SEVERAL B-CLASS SUBFLARES. THIS REGION IS MAGNETICALLY BIPOLAR. A LARGE PROMINENCE CENTERED NEAR S17E90 ERUPTED TO 0.17R ABOVE THE LIMB BETWEEN 04/0343-0450Z. THE SOUTHEAST LIMB SHOWED ENHANCED X-RAY EMISSION WHERE OLD REGION 7871 IS DUE TO RETURN.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS FORECAST TO BE
sections.text: VERY LOW. CONTINUED GROWTH IN REGION 7874 COULD RESULT IN SMALL C-CLASS FLARES FROM THAT AREA. THE REGION APPROACHING THE SOUTHEAST LIMB MAY ALSO RAISE ACTIVITY LEVELS SLIGHTLY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 03/2100Z TO 04/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED. SOLAR WIND DATA CONTINUED TO SHOW A DECREASE IN WIND VELOCITY (500 KM/S) AS THE CORONAL HOLE RELATED DISTURBANCE WANED. ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUXES WERE MODERATE TO HIGH.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.text: TO 05/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW. REGION 7874 (N01W42) GREW SIGNIFICANTLY TO AN AREA OF APPROXIMATELY 180 MILLIONTHS WITH FREQUENT B-CLASS X-RAY FLARES. THE GROUP SHOWS SOME MAG- NETIC COMPLEXITY IN THE SMALL SPOTS NEAR REGION CENTER. TWO NEW A-TYPE GROUPS WERE ASSIGNED TODAY: 7876 (N12W59) AND 7877 (N10E38).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. REGION 7874 APPEARS TO HAVE THE POTENTIAL FOR A C-CLASS FLARE. THERE IS A VERY SLIGHT CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENT.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN MOSTLY QUIET FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE GREATER THAN 2 MEV ELECTRON FLUXES OBSERVED BY GOES WERE AT HIGH LEVELS THROUGHOUT THE DAY.

sections.text: TO 07/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW. REGION 7877 (N09E11) CONTINUED GROWTH AND DEVELOPED SMALL PENUMBRA ON THE LEADER AND TRAILER SPOTS. THE GROUP HAS A SIMPLE BETA MAGNETIC CONFIGURA- TION. AN 8 DEGREE FILAMENT NEAR S13E07 ERUPTED BETWEEN 0721Z AND 0757Z. PARALLEL H-ALPHA RIBBONS AND A WEAK GOES X-RAY EVENT (B4.1) WERE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS EVENT. THE GOES SIGNATURE HAD A GRADUAL RISE AND FALL CHARACTER. AN ADDITIONAL FILAMENT NEAR S03W60 DISAPPEARED BETWEEN 06/2322Z AND 07/0026Z.

sections.text: VERY LOW TO LOW.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. THERE IS A ENHANCED PROBABILITY, HOWEVER, FOR ACTIVE CON- DITIONS ON THE SECOND AND THIRD DAYS DUE TO THE POSSIBLE EFFECTS FROM TODAY'S DISAPPEARING FILAMENT.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 17/2100Z
sections.text: TO 18/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW. NEW REGION 7882 (N06E70) PRODUCED A SHORT-LIVED B2/SF FLARE AT 18/1700Z. FOUR OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED B-CLASS X-RAY BURSTS WERE DETECTED. A 12 DEGREE DISAPPEARING FILAMENT WAS REPORTED IN THE SOUTHEAST QUADRANT OF THE SOLAR DISK BUT IS NOT EXPECTED TO PRODUCE A DISTURBANCE. NEW REGION 7881 (N01E06) WAS ALSO NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: VERY LOW. REGION 7882 HAS A CHANCE OF PRODUCING ISOLATED C-CLASS FLARE ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 17/2100Z TO 18/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. ALL LATITUDES EXPERIENCED ONE PERIOD OF MINOR STORMING AT ABOUT 18/0900Z. THE CAUSE OF THIS ACTIVITY IS NOT IMMEDIATELY APPARENT. SOLAR WIND DATA RECEIVED FROM THE WIND SPACECRAFT INDICATED A MODERATELY HIGH DENSITY WIND WITH LOW VELOCITY AND A NORTHWARD BZ JUST AFTER THE TIME OF THE DISTURBANCE INDICATING A TRANSIENT CAUSE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS. THE FIELD IS THEN EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST PERIOD BECAUSE OF A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE. HIGH LATITUDE STATIONS MAY SEE PERIODS OF MINOR TO MAJOR STORMING DURING THAT TIME.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 27/2100Z
sections.text: TO 28/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW. ONLY TWO B-CLASS X- RAY FLARES WERE OBSERVED TODAY. THE LARGEST WAS A B4.5 AT 0436Z WHICH WAS NOT SEEN OPTICALLY. THE EVENT HAD A LONG DECAY TIME OF 36 MINUTES FROM X-RAY MAXIMUM TO HALF POWER. REGION 7882 (N03W64) WAS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE OTHER B1.9 EVENT AT 1237Z. REGION 7882 CONTINUED TO DECAY AND WAS STABLE. EVIDENCE FOR THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 7877 COULD BE SEEN ON YOHKOH IMAGES TODAY WITH THE APPEARANCE OF BRIGHT LOOPS ON EAST LIMB AT ABOUT N05.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: VERY LOW. THERE SHOULD BE A STEADY INCREASE IN BACKGROUND LEVELS AS THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 7877 ROTATES INTO VIEW.

sections.text: TO 16/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW. NO FLARES WERE OB- SERVED. REGION 7890 (N03W12) IS THE ONLY SPOTTED REGION ON THE DISK. THE GROUP SHOWED SLOW DECAY THROUGHOUT THE DAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: VERY LOW.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 15/2100Z TO 16/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM QUIET TO STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. AN INITIALLY QUIET FIELD BECAME DISTURBED AFTER 1300Z. FROM 1300-2100Z CONDITIONS HAVE BEEN AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS, WITH SOME MAJOR STORM PERIODS AT HIGH LATITUDES. WIND DATA SHOW A JUMP IN SOLAR WIND DENSITY RANG- ING FROM 20-50 P/CC BETWEEN 1327-1537Z, SUGGESTING THAT A CORONAL TRANSIENT INITIATED TODAY'S ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT TWO DAYS. TODAY'S ACTIVITY SHOULD PERSIST FOR AT LEAST 12 HOURS. IN ADDITION, A CORONAL HOLE IS IN FAVORABLE POSITION TO PRODUCE DISTURBED LEVELS OVER THE NEXT TWO DAYS. PREDOMINANTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS ARE EXPECTED ON THE THIRD DAY OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 16/2100Z TO 17/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM QUIET TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS PREDOMINATED FROM 16/2100Z THROUGH 17/0700Z. A BRIEF LULL FROM 0700-1200Z WAS FOLLOWED BY ANOTHER INCREASE TO ACTIVE LEVELS FROM 1200-1600Z. SINCE 1600Z THROUGH THE END OF THE PERIOD, QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS HAVE PREVAILED. DATA FROM THE WIND SPACECRAFT (1420-1708Z) IN- DICATED A HIGH-SPEED, LOW DENSITY SOLAR WIND. THIS SUGGESTS THAT A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE IS THE MOST LIKELY CAUSE OF THE LATTER PART OF TODAY'S ACTIVITY, THE GREATER THAN 2 MEV ELECTRON FLUXES AT GOES-8 (W078) EXCEEDED 1000 PFU AT 1310Z AND HAVE REMAINED ABOVE THIS LEVEL THROUGH THE END OF THE DAY.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS. A DECREASE TO MOSTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS IS EXPECTED FOR THE SECOND AND THIRD DAYS.

sections.text: TO 13/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY REMAINED VERY LOW. REGION 7899 (S18E44) WAS STABLE AND EXHIBITED REVERSE POLARITY. A SEGMENTED FILAMENT BETWEEN S24E23-S36E53 FADED BETWEEN 12/1943-13/0013Z. SOME SEGMENTS DISAPPEARED RAPIDLY WHILE OTHERS FADED SLOWLY. NO YOHKOH DATA ARE AVAILABLE FOR THIS TIME PERIOD BUT IT IS LIKELY A CORONAL MASS EJECTION OCCURRED FROM THIS AREA.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 12/2100Z TO 13/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE 0000-0600Z PERIOD WHEN MANY SITES EXPERIENCED ACTIVE CONDITIONS. ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUXES BEGAN THE PERIOD AT HIGH LEVELS BUT DROPPED QUICKLY TO LOW-MODERATE LEVELS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD BE PREDOMINANTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR 14-15 AUG. ISOLATED ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE POSSIBLE ON 14 AUG. A DISTURBANCE RELATED TO THE DISAPPEARING FILAMENT MENTIONED ABOVE IS FORECAST TO BEGIN LATE ON 16 AUG. ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM PERIODS ARE POSSIBLE. THE TIMING OF THE ARRIVAL OF THIS DISTURBANCE IS DIFFICULT TO FORECAST.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.  THE FIELD INCREASED IN ACTIVITY TO ACTIVE TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS AT APPROXIMATELY 17/1100UT, BUT HAS QUIETED DOWN TO MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS SINCE 17/1800UT. THE GREATER THAN 2 MEV ELECTRON FLUX FROM THE GOES-8 SATELLITE INDICATED BORDERLINE HIGH TO VERY HIGH LEVELS FROM 16/2100UT TO 17/0300UT.  SINCE THEN, THE FLUX STEADILY DECLINED TO MODERATE LEVELS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 12/2100Z TO 13/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. AN INITIALLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED FIELD BECAME MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE WITH SOME MINOR STORMING AT HIGH LATITUDES BETWEEN 0400-1200Z. CONDITIONS HAVE BEEN PREDOMINANTLY QUIET SINCE 1200Z. WIND OBSERVATIONS SUGGEST THAT THE ACTIVITY WAS MOST LIKELY CAUSED BY A HIGH SPEED, LOW DENSITY WIND STREAM. SUCH STREAMS TYPICALLY ORIGINATE FROM CORONAL HOLES. THE GREATER THAN 2 MEV ELECTRON FLUX WAS HIGH THROUGHOUT THE DAY.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO SLIGHTLY ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT TWO DAYS. CONDITIONS SHOULD BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED BY THE THIRD DAY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 14/2100Z TO 15/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT QUIET TO MINOR STORM LEVELS WITH SOME BRIEF HIGH LATITUDE MAJOR STORM PERIODS. AN INITIALLY QUIET FIELD BECAME DISTURBED FROM ABOUT 0200-1500Z. MID- LATITUDES WERE AT MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS, AND HIGH LATITUDES WERE PREDOMINANTLY AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. A BRIEF INTERVAL OF WIND DATA INDICATED A MODERATE DENSITY (10-20P/CC), MODERATE SPEED (440-450KM/S) WIND WITH FAIRLY STRONG NEGATIVE BZ (-7 TO -5 NT). THESE DATA SUGGEST THAT A TRANSIENT IN THE SOLAR WIND WAS THE CAUSE OF THE ACTIVITY. CONDITIONS DECLINED TO QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FROM 1500Z TO THE END OF THE PERIOD. THE GREATER THAN 2 MEV ELECTRON FLUXES RANGED FROM NORMAL BACKGROUND TO HIGH LEVELS DURING THE PAST 24 HOURS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO SLIGHTLY ACTIVE OVER THE NEXT 12 TO 24 HOURS DUE TO PERSISTENCE. QUIET TO UNSETTLED CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.
